text: LISA LEMON, 34, walks up to the bagel store, reading the paper, wearing her ipod. Two Upper West Side moms chat, blocking the entrance with their enormous double strollers.
I nursed Zach til he was 22 months...
Excuse me...
Weren’t you worried about nipple confusion?
Excuse me...
No. He went right from my breast to a sippy cup.
That happened to me once. Can I get by? They still don’t hear her.
What about silicone nipple shields? Lisa has no choice but to back up a few steps and take a running jump over the children and into the bagel place. The moms are appalled.
If you had kids, you would not be laughing!
Lisa waits in a long line leading to two registers. A GUY on a cell phone enters. He ignores the line and goes up to the other register.
Whoa, whoa, Excuse me. There’s a line, buddy.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
The guy points to where he’s standing. Guy There‘s two lines.
No, what? No. There’s one line, we’re in it. Guy I don’t think so. The guy goes back to talking on his cell phone. He holds his finger up to the counter girl to wait.

You don’t think so? You think there‘s two lines and we all chose to be in this one and you’re the only genius who got in the other line? (looks to others) Do you believe this guy? The other people just shrug and avert their eyes. The back half of the line goes and lines up behind the guy.

LISA (CONT’D) What are you doing?! He screws you over and now you’re lining up behind him? The stroller moms join the back of his line. They stare Lisa down. LISA (CONT’D) Will not one of you stand with me?i
Hey, shut up-- (into his phone) What kind do you want? Shut up?!! Lisa is now at the front of her line, boiling
Can I help you?

Yeah, I’1ll take everything. I want every bagel in this place. (to everyone) I’m buying all the bagels. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Lisa hands her a credit card. The cell phone guy rolls his eyes.
What?! Come on, lady. Boo! Etc...
it's for the qood of everyone!

“Old Skool” opening credit sequence to music in the style of “My Red Letter Day” from The Ziegfeld Follies. A beaming Lisa passes out bagels to everyone she sees. Some people are grateful. Most are mistrustful and throw them away as soon as she passes. She heads through town and ends up at 30 ROCKEFELLER PLAZA!
The studio's homebase set. Workmen are polishing a big sign that reads, "Friday Night Bits with Jenna DeCarlo,"
Pull back through the picture window to where KENNETH a bright and chirpy (Clay Aiken type) NBC page is giving a tour. He stands next to a life-size standee of impish comedian Jenna DeCarlo. .
And this is the set of the "Friday Night Bits with Jenna DeCarlo." (points to standee) It's a real funny ladies’ comedy show for ladies.
What time is it on?
Fridays at 10. But, seriously, sir, it's just for ladies. Candy quiz! Can anybody name other shows that only ladies like?
Desperate Housewives? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
Yes. Kenneth throws the guy a piece of candy.
"Sex in The City?"
No. (throws candy) I’m sorry, it’s Sex and the City. I cannot accept that. Kenneth does not throw the guy candy. The elevator doors open and Lisa comes out, carrying one small bag of bagels.
Hey, everybody, here's someone you'd never get to meet. This is the head- writer of Friday Night Bits, Lisa Lemon. Kenneth claps. The tour group stares blankly. Lisa smiles embarrassedly and waves.
Hi. Beat. A fat kid in the front burps.
Lisa xuns into PETE HORNBERGER, 43, her friend and longtime producer.
What's up? Have you looked at that ‘“Judgemental Baby” sketch? Cause it’s still seven minutes long.
Yikes, okay. Hey, you gotta tell that NBC page to take it down a notch.
Who Kenneth?
He just embarrassed me in front of a whole tour group. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
I'll talk to him, (notices bagels) What's this?
(smiles) I was in the bagel store and this guy comes in--

At a large conference table, TOOFER, 25, an African- American Harvard guy writer and FRANK, 27, a heavyset writer with long 2% Top hair and glasses, read the papers. In the corner, SARIE, a gorgeous 22 year old assistant (of the spray-tanned platinum-haired Hilton variety) answers the phone.
Friday Night Bits. Okay, hold on, I'll connect you. She somehow looks sexy transferring calls. Toofer and Frank stare at her. Next call.

Friday Night Bits. Our fax number? Sarie kneels backwards on her chair to look at the fax machine, a lower back tattoo is revealed. _Toofer gives Frank $5 (clearly, they had a bet.) Lisa enters, finishing her story to Pete.
And I was like, “Give me all the bagels, dammit!”
(takes bagel) Wow. That is the longest stroy I’ve ever had to listen to to get a free bagel. Pete continues down the hall. Toofer complains to Lisa immediately.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  €
Chumley, you have got to talk to someone upstairs about getting us a stock of beverages.
Good morning.
I mean, surely our massive conglomerate parent company could spring for a samovar of coffee. ,
Or, like, a big coffee dispenser.
That's what a samovar is.
Sorry, I wasn’t raised gay. JOSH, 23, enters. He is an adorable young comedian/cast member on “The Jenna DeCarlo Show.”
Hey, who does this sound like?
Josh does a flawless imitation of President Bush.
“My fellow Americans, the situation in Iraq grows more tense each day. The insurgeons and evil-spreaders has left me no choice but to ask for a do-over.”
Martin Van Buren?
Ron Jeremy? Josh is playful, unfazed by their meanness.
No, it was supposed to be your mom.
No. My mom’s voice is way lower.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
(to Lisa) Dude, can we at least send out for coffee?
Yeah, but I'm not treating. I just spent $600 on bagels. Wanna know why? NO ONE BITES.
Nah... no thanks... etc.
Sarie, can we order some coffees?
(laying on the couch) Yeah. I'll have a soy latte. Sarie goes back to her magazine. Lisa looks at her for a beat, then writes down the coffee order herself.
Sarie, soy latte. Josh?
Large oreo brownie mochaccino, please. With whipped cream.
23. Must be nice. Toofer?
Short non-fat Ethiopian Yergacheffe.
That‘s what you are, isn’t it?
{ignores him) And if they don't have that blend then, please, just a steamed milk with a skoche of Amarretto syrup.
You really are gross. Toofer smiles and tips an imaginary hat. e@ Frank?
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
A hamburger.
That's not...
What? It's the same price.
Fine.
Pete gently reprimanding Kenneth the page.
--and you probably don't need to introduce the writers to the tour group.
I agree. I thought they would find it interesting, but they really did not. So I took them downstairs and showed them Debra Norville's private toilet--

location: OUTSIDE THE DOOR OF DEBRA NORVILLE'S PRIVATE TOILET.

text: Kenneth addresses a large tour group outside her bathroom,
+..to be used by no one but her. Loud embarrassing toilet sounds emanate from within.
Oops!
Yeah, it's been my experience, Kenneth, that people do best with as little information as possible. (MORE)
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
wo If you pass a celebrity with the tour group, just respect their privacy.
I don't know. Conan O'Brien gets real mad if I don't make a big fuss over him.
Okay, well, feel it out. Make eye contact with the person. Try to read their facial expression. Do they want the attention?
I promise I'll get it right, Mr. Hornberger.
I'm sure you will.
(tearing up) I just love television so much.
We all do.
Lisa and the writers are sitting around the table rewriting a sketch. But Lisa has stopped to tell them her bagel story.
And I was, like, “Screw you! I’m buying all the bagels!” The boys are not impressed or interested.
That's great. You should make that into a movie for the Lifetime Network.
“All the Bagels: The Lisa Lemon Story.“
Starring Linda Hunt. Okay, where were we? Frank reads a part aloud.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  ‘s
Bottom of 4, “Hey, kids, who wants a big bowl of Flakey-o’s?”
I don't like "Flakey-o's." What's a better fake cereal name?
Oat Bung?
Chocolate Log Jam.
Cornholes?
Sugar Cornholes.
Frosted mini-guns.
Meat Puffs?
Kashi Go Poo.
Pete enters. Phone rings. Sarie answers it.
Pete. Fake cereal name.
Branfuckers. [bleeped
We have a winner.
Pete, they want you and Lisa on the 50th E£loor.
Who, Gary?
Get him to pay for my Samovar.
T'll get it. I’1l get it right now. I’m S still fired up from my bagel incident. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
Josh is passing through.
{to Frank) What bagel incident?
If you ask her, I will stab you.
What do we want?
A coffee maker, coffee, and an array of milks.
Three cases of name-brand soda a day.
Cable tv.
A snack basket.
Custom made Nikes with the name of the show on the tongue and our initials on the heel.
Josh, bend it, don’t break it.
Pete and Lisa wait for the elevator.
Gary will give us all this, right?
Of course he will. He's the nicest man in the world. Remember when he found that baby bird in the park?
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  12.
c.U. of Gary Luderman, 50, a square-looking corporate guy in a suit. He is intently feeding a baby bird with an eye dropper.
Hey, fella. Hey, fella. (smiles up to the camera) I‘m gonna name him Fella.
(sings) Gary Luderman is the nicest man in the wooorld! They turn the corner into...

The whole place is under noisy renovation. Workmen everywhere. Pete and Lisa step in to see JACK DONAGHY, 45, handsome and impeccably dressed, kicks his way into the room through a partially ripped out wall.
Where's Gary?
Gary's dead. I'm Jack Donaghy. New VP of development for NBC/GE/Universal/Vivendi/kmart.
We own Kmart now?
No, we don't. So why are you dressed like we do? Pete and Lisa look at their overly casual work clothes.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
Josh, Toofer and Frank are working. Sarie answers the
Friday Night Bits. (beat) This is Sarie. (exasperated) Mommy, why are you calling me?
(to Toofer) Are you guys just staring at the new receptionist or are you actually trying to levitate her with your minds?
Shhh, I have to hear this. They eavesdrop on Sarie.
Of course I showed up for work. You don't have to, like, check on me all the time. (quietly) I took the helicopter.
{to Josh) Her parents are some rich famous big shots and they got her this job because they want her to learn the value of work. Sarie takes out her gum, folds it in a dollar bill and throws it out.
Who are her parents?
She won't say.
She says it would affect the way we treat her.
No, I would still try to make out with her. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
She doesn't do it for me. My perfect woman is a standard size 12, still in her waitress uniform, with her kid asleep in the next room, The other two nod in reluctant agreement. That is kind of hot.
Kenneth is giving another tour.
Rockefeller Center was built in the 1930‘s by--anyone?
The Rockefellers? Kenneth throws the guy a piece of candy.

Correct. Studio 8E was constructed in 1951 for a show called “The Vicks Vap-o- Rub Fun Hour.” In the 1970's it was used for a talk show by a gentleman named Phil Donahoo, And now it’s home to the Jenna DeCarlo-- Kenneth sees JENNA DECARLO come off the elevator. He tries to assess her mood. She takes off her sunglasses and looks at Kenneth. She has a crazy wide-eyed expression that means, "Don't bother me." But her face is so animated and friendly that Kenneth can't "read" it. Kenneth smiles at Jenna. Jenna smiles/grimaces back. There is a back and forth moment of panic between Kenneth and Jenna as they try to interpret each others' expressions. Then, one of the tour group recognizes her--
Hey, that's Jenna DeCarlo!

Ooh, Jenna DeCarlo! Jenna! Etc. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  15. Flashbulbs. Jenna looks hung-over and disheveled. The exact opposite of her picture on the standee behind her. She can't help but blurt out her thoughts to the crowd.

Hi, let me explain that I'm really hung over right now and that's why I look like this, But I'm not normally hung over on a Wednesday. I tried a new tapas restaurant in my neighborhood last night and the waiter recognized me so he kept giving me free mojitos-- which doesn't happen all the time, I'm not like, some gross famous person-- but he kept bringing them and I don't usually drink hard liquor cause I'm really small and I can get drunk so easily-- (she starts to giggle with embarrassment ) I mean, I don't get drunk frequently. She grabs the arm of a tourist for emphasis.
I'm just saying that if I look a little green there are extenuating circumstances.
denna exits around a corner. Beat.
How about that? Jenna DeCarlo, every-- Jenna comes back around.
But I don't want people to think I'm not friendly. I'm just nauseous and I have stomach issues-- The group nods politely.
Okay. She starts to exit.
Forget I said "stomach issues." Okay. Bye.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  16.
Pete and Lisa sit gingerly on the edge of the couch. Workmen work behind them. Jack sits at his desk which has a lot of exposed wires hanging over it. Nearby we see the legs of a workman on a ladder.
I'm surprised you're renovating. This is such a nice office.

It’s a great office. But sometimes you have to change things that are perfectly good just to make them your own. Pete and Lisa look a little worried. Jack's nerdy MALE ASSISTANT appears and hands Jack a note written on a post-it.
T'1l call her back. Is she at the White House number?
Assistant nods. He hands him another post-it.
Tell them I need a 4 a.m. tee time. He hands him another post-it.

About five inches, but it's thick. Pete and Lisa look at each other. As he exits, the assistant gets a little shock to the head from a dangling wire and flinches slightly. Jack turns his attention to Pete and Lisa.
Are you familiar with the award-winning GE Tri-vection oven?
I don't cook very much,
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

Sure. I got you. New York third wave feminist. College-educated. Single and pretending to be happy about it. Over- scheduled, under-sexed. You buy any Magazine that says "healthy body image" on the cover, but your kitchen's got nothing but Snackwelis and expired yogurts. You reject traditional female roles, but every two years you take up knitting for a week.
(impressed) That's dead on.
Are you gonna guess my weight now?
You don’t want me to do that.
That knitting thing is just uncanny. How do you do that?
Market research, my friend. Years and years of market research... that lead to my greatest triumph, the Tri-vection oven.
My wife wants one of those. The assistant reappears. Another post-it to read.

(to the assistant) Yes, but I'll need my kevlar vest. (back to Pete and Lisa with a smile) The Trivection oven cooks perfect food five times faster than a conventional oven, because it uses three kinds of heat: thermal technology, for consistent temperature; GE Precise Air™ convection technology, for optimal air circulation; and microwave technology, for unbelievable speed. With three kinds of heat, you can cook a turkey in 22 minutes.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  18.
Wow. That’s impressive.
The people upstairs agree. That‘s why they promoted me. That’s why I’m here to re-tool your show.
Re-tool what now?
I'm the new Vice President of East Coast Television and Microwave Oven Programming.
That sounds like you program microwave ovens.
(to his asst.) See, I told you that was imprecise. Make it "Vice President of East Coast Television Programming and Microwave Oven- to x LISA me Czar?
I like you. You have the boldness of a much younger woman. Lisa is offended. Some sparks literally fly, from the construction behind her.
You know, Jack, Lisa and I have worked together on a bunch of shows over the last ten years, and I know Gary was very pleased--
Pete, I've seen the show. The little gal‘s good.
Jenna.
And the skits are decent, but you're missing that third kind of heat.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  sane!
There's the kind of heat that rises from dog poop. Maybe we could use that.
Think about Lawrence Jordan.
The black guy?
The black movie star. I flew with him recently on a private jet to the Super - Bowl, and he was very entertaining.
Isn't he, um... crazy?
Lawrence has had his problems in the last few years.
African-American comedy star LAWRENCE JORDAN, 35, runs down through traffic in nothing but tighty whities.
Lama jedi! I ama jedi!
But it's important to remember that he was never charged with any crime. It's not illegal to fall asleep on your neighbor's roof.
Nor should it be.
Lawrence Jordan is the "third heat."
So would he join the cast...? Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
Join the cast, permanent guest host-- I’m going to meet with him this afternoon and see what he thinks-- Lisa clears a place to lay down on the coffee table.
What are you doing?
Sometimes when IT have these stress dreams, if I go to sleep in the dream, I come out of it. The Assistant scribbles then hands her a post-it.
(reads) "This is not a dream."
Jonathan, take Pete and help him pick out a Trivection oven for his wife.
(pleased) Hey.
Wait. Lisa takes out her list. LISA (CONT’D) We also want a coffee machine, a snack basket --
Done. Jonathan? The assistant takes her list of demands. After he and Pete exit... JACK (CONT‘D) Lisa, I’ve heard a lot of good things about you.
Well, a lot of that stuff I don’t do anymore. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
I just want you to know that your job is secure. You’re gonna be essential to transforming the’ show.

No, no, no, Jack. Jenna is my friend and we like our show the way it is. It may not get the highest ratings, but we have our own little following, and I'm not going to let you come in here and turn it into some kind of--
Hit?
Just let me talk to her before you make any concrete-- The wall behind her comes tumbling down. A chunk of drywall hits her on the head. LISA (CONT’D) Mother-effer-! She falls down.
A sketch from the show. Josh wears a fake moustache. Jenna is performing a crazy character with a goofy voice.
Yes, I have an appointment with Louise.
Glouise isn’t here. I’m Bevergly. Recognition applause. This is a recurring character. JENNA (CONT’D) And I'll be your substitute hair styglist! Laughter.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
INT. WRITER’S ROOM - AFTERNOON Toofer and Frank are watching a tape of this sketch.
We should do one where “Bevergly” is a “grape” counselor. Toofer hands him a frothy cappuccino in a glass mug. Across the room, Josh is going through a large snack basket.
dust tell me who your parents are.
No. You couldn't handle it.
Okay, I'm gonna try to guess who they are from looking at your face. He studies her.
Blond hair, little nose, kind of Swedish... Your mom is... Cheryl Tiegs and your dad is... (checks out her body) Stephen Hawking. Sarie punches him in the arm.
What? Cause you're smart!
Pete is talking to Kenneth again.
...and Jenna DeCarlo was very upset.

I tried to read her face, but it’s so rubbery! Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  ‘ How bout this? As a rule, if you see a celebrity when you’re with the tour group, do not bother them.
Is that a guideline, or a rule? Cause I respond well to structure.
Let’s say it’s a rule.
Lisa gets off the elevator holding an ice pack to her head. She runs smack into Jenna. Lisa acts weird and
awkward.
Hey.
Hey. What happened to your head?
The sky is falling. Do you have a minute?
No. I have a costume fitting for the “Judgemental Baby” sketch.
. Abh. 1I’11 find you after.
You seem upset.
You seem upset.
I‘m hung over.

(seemingly reminiscing) Remember, like, five years ago when you were still waitressing and I was temping at that law firm and we used to do improv shows for free at night? f Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
Yeah. JENNA
Did we hate it?
Yeah. We hated it a lot.
That’s what I thought. INT. WRITER’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Lisa enters to find everyone excitedly enjoying the new high-end coffee machine, snack basket, cable tv, etc. Toofer hands her a cappuccino.
Well done, m’ lady!
How’d you get everything so fast?
What can I say? I‘m a hardass.
She ducks into Pete's office.
He is finishing up a phone call.
Well, my condolences. Please let me know where we can send flowers. Okay. He hangs up. PETE (CONT’D) Ugh, poor Gary.
How did he die?
Killed by a deer.
What?
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

He used to feed the deer every morning at his house upstate. And then he got an injunction from the township saying he had to stop. So he did. Two days later, he goes out to get his paper, and the deer go mad. Pete makes an accompanying hand gesture like deer paws clawing at someone.
They just went mad? She mimics the same gesture. Pete nods and does it again.
He stopped feeding them and they turned on him.
What are we gonna do? We quit, right? Do we quit?
Not me. My twins need braces.
The older twins or the identicals?
All four. They've got mouths like piranhas. He hands her a picture from his desk.
Ew. They do.
But sometimes with a thing like this, if you wait it out, it goes away on its own.
{still looking at the picture) No, you gotta get the braces.
Jack Donaghy, I'm talking about. So he meets with crazy Lawrence Jordan today. (MORE)
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
Jordan'11 ask for too much money or he'll show up wearing a child's swimsuit and a shower cap and Donaghy will change his mind. Nobody needs to know this ever came up. Josh enters.

Oh, hey, awesome. Just the people I was looking for. I'm working on this bit about celebrities doing commercials, like- (imitates Christopher Walken perfectly) "This is Christopher Walken for Tropicana orange juice. Try the juice. It’s very... tangy” Or, um-- {imitates Lawrence Jordan perfectly) “Yo, this is Lawrence Jordan, star of ‘Black Cop/White. Cop' and when I want a good night's sleep, I sleep on my neighbor's roof. But now that I'm making a comeback, I sleep at the Best Western. Best Western. It's like sleeping on Ted Danson's roof. Holla!"
Okay, I don't know what you've heard, but Lawrence Jordan is not joining the cast. He is not taking over for Jenna. We are not turning into The Lawrence Jordan Show.
What? She realizes he didn't know any of this.
Nothing.
Nicely handled.
Kenneth is answering questions from another tour group.
Yes, Katie Couric is real tiny in person. (stage whisper) (MORE)
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

But her boobs are a lot bigger than you would think. The elevator doors open and LAWRENCE JORDAN, 30, enters with a small entourage, looking totally kickass. Cool music under. As they get close to the tour group, Kenneth sees Lawrence [a big movie star!] and, panicking, diverts the group's attention. KENNETH (CONT’D) Now, if y'all look over here, you'll see a water fountain! Lawrence stops behind the group and waits for Kenneth to acknowledge him. Kenneth starts to sweat.
Does anyone have any questions about it? Lawrence gives his posse a look like, "What the hell? Why isn't this guy acknowledging me?"
Yes, I have a question. (big smile) How do you feel, NBC Tour? Cause you look like a portay!
(timidly) Lawrence Jordan, everybody. The group applauds excitedly to see Lawrence. Lawrence goes over and works the crowd.

(To a pregnant lady) You're beautiful, little Mama. You're doing God's work. (Talks in a "honky" voice to a middle aged white guy) Don't I know you from the insurance meeting? We've got to sign those papers, Reginald. The guy laughs. Lawrence goes to a skinny, sullen, white teen. Lawrence puts his arm around the kid very sincerely. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  28. o u
Listen. I know being your age is hard. But don't you "put on the trench coat.” You hear me? You have a problem, you call me. Don't put on that trench coat. The kid nods.
(to everyone) Live. Life. Love. Laugh! The group applauds. There is such a thing as "star quality."
Does Jenna know?
I gotta tell her before she hears it somewhere else.
She's been around the block. She can handle bad news.
Yeah... Off Lisa's look... cur TO:
The waitress serves Jenna her breakfast.
(dejected) I said wheat toast. She bursts into tears.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  «
She's gonna freak out. Toofer enters, indignant.
I will not work with Lawrence Jordan.
It's just a rumor.
I worked with him at the MTV awards two years ago, where he found it endlessly amusing to show me his johnson.
How was it?
Considerable. On one occasion, he had placed it in a foot-long hot dog bun and put mustard on it. I loathe him. Sarie stands in the doorway.
He's not that bad. He rents near us in East Hampton. I saw him once at a charity polo match.
Did he seem crazy?
No. Well... he was making out with Martha Stewart...but we’ve all done that. They all stare at her for a beat. SARIE (CONT’D} Joking.
Have you seen any of his movies? The guy's sensibility is just cretinous.
I saw the one where he plays, like, five different characters. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
poy ae 30.
"Black Cop/White Cop"
No.
“Who Dat Ninja?"
No, he was... god, they all blend together, don't they? He had to pretend to be an old lady--
Yes, yes. He actually says the title at one point... Off their thinking... cuT TO:
A clip from one of Lawrence Jordan's movies. He is dressed as a big fat white grandma a la Mrs. Doubtfire. Unseen parties are throwing pies at him.
Oh, gracious goodness! You hooligans better watch out! A pie hits him. He suddenly sounds masculine and black.
Cause this honky grandma be trippin!
(relieved to remember} "Honky Grandma Be Trippin’."
Oh, yeah. That movie was hilarious. Lisa glares at him. Frank bursts in, incredulous. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
Is what I heard true?!
Not
Gary Luderman got killed by a deer?!
Oh yeah, by the way, everybody. Gary Luderman got killed by a deer. Before anyone can react, Jenna enters. She is ina ridiculous baby costume [over-sized diaper, pinafore, bonnet] .
You guys, you have to come see this! You know that crazy actor guy from “Who Dat Ninja?" He's in our studio! It's hilarious! You have to see it. Jenna runs out. They all run out after her.
Every face is pressed up against the picture window of the studio. They look shocked.
Lawrence Jordan paces around the homebase set, preaching to the empty seats.
I'm back, America! I'm coming into your house. Lawrence grabs the camera and talks into the lens like Bono.
I'm coming into your house, Americal Jack encourages him proudly from the empty seats.
We love you, Lawrence! Come into our homes! Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
Lawrence removes his shirt.
I'm the third heat! I'm the third heat!
You're the third heat, baby! Out by the picture window, Jenna turns to Lisa, chuckling.
This guy's full-tilt nuts. Am I right? Kenneth arrives with a tour group.

Here we see the set for “Friday Night Bits.” (stage whisper) . Although the industry buzz is it's being re-tooled into The Lawrence Jordan Sh-- Pete leaps over and chokes Kenneth to shut him up. The tour group gasps. Jenna turns to Lisa.
What did he say?
Jenna, I have some news. Don't freak out. Jenna stares at her wide-eyed for a beat, then... cuT TO:
Jenna, in the baby costume, running through traffic [much like Lawrence Jordan], out of her mind.
I ama jedi! I ama jedi!
Everyone's gathered around Lawrence Jordan, he’s holding court. Lisa watches from the balcony above. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
Now at the time, me and Eddie were both talking to the same girl, ‘cept I didn’t know she was a transexual... Everyone laughs.
(to herself) Will not one of you stand with me? Jack Donaghy walks over to her.

Would you like me to review for you everything you've done wrong so far? You’ve hired a guy so crazy that nobody else in the world will work with him right now. You brought him in here without even talking to Jenna first, which will send her into a two-year spiral. You’re putting him in my hands, knowing I don’t want him here. You gave my greedy, insatiable writing staff every toy they asked for, which only means they will have a longer list of things they want tomorrow. Don't stop feeding those deer, Mr. Donaghy, or they will turn on you.
You'll make it work.
What makes you think that?
Cause your friend Jenna’s got nowhere else to go. You'll be nice to Lawrence, cause it’s not his fauit. And you’ll focus all your rage and hatred on me.
Ugh, you know what? You don’t know everything about me. She storms out of frame. Jack watches her walk away.
About 127 pounds. From off camera, she whips a water bottle at him.
Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  34.
